summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing final preparations for filing motions in limine in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails involve coordinating cite-checking, creating tables of contents and authorities, and seeking assistance from paralegals and interns.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The email signature identifies an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, indicating this is official correspondence from the prosecution team in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Motions in Limine Deadline for Maxwell Case
events.description: The prosecution's motions in limine for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial were due, prompting final coordination and cite-checking efforts among legal staff.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York preparing motions in limine for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in October 2021.
Email correspondence reveals internal coordination among legal staff including prosecutors, contractors, and potentially interns for finalizing legal documents.
The document demonstrates the procedural aspects of trial preparation, specifically cite-checking and creating tables of contents and authorities.
The email chain indicates the motions in limine were substantial in length, requiring multiple staff members to complete final preparations.
